meanings.definition: Unjustly inflicting hardship and constraint, especially on a minority or other subordinate group.
meanings.sent1: The oppressive rules made life difficult for the minority community.
meanings.sent2: The oppressive government restricted the rights of its citizens.
meanings.sent3: The oppressive heat made everyone want to stay indoors.
meanings.sent4: The oppressive workload felt like a heavy weight on their shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The oppressive atmosphere in the room was suffocating.

meanings.definition: Weighing heavily on the mind or spirits; causing depression or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: Her oppressive thoughts kept her up at night.
meanings.sent2: The oppressive silence in the room was unsettling.
meanings.sent3: The oppressive mood at the party made everyone leave early.
meanings.sent4: The oppressive memories haunted him wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The oppressive feeling of loneliness consumed her heart.

meanings.definition: Overwhelming or burdensome in effect or force.
meanings.sent1: The oppressive responsibility of caring for her siblings weighed on her.
meanings.sent2: The oppressive workload left him exhausted at the end of the day.
meanings.sent3: The oppressive amount of homework made the students groan.
meanings.sent4: The oppressive smell of the garbage filled the entire street.
meanings.sent5: The oppressive sound of the alarm clock shattered the peaceful morning.
